Class ShipBoard

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.ShipBoard
Direct Known Subclasses:
ShipBoardEasy, ShipBoardNormal
public abstract class ShipBoard extends Object
An abstract representation of a player's spaceship board in the Galaxy Trucker game. This class provides the core logic for managing ship components, their placement, rotation, connections, and interactions. It serves as a base for concrete implementations specific to different game modes (e.g., Easy, Normal).

  • Constructor Details

    • ShipBoard

      protected ShipBoard(HousingColor color, FlyBoard flyBoard)
      Protected constructor for initializing the common properties of a ShipBoard. Sets up the grid dimensions, initializes matrices, and places the starting cabin.
      Parameters:
      color - The HousingColor of the player's cabin.
      flyBoard - The FlyBoard instance this ship belongs to.

  • Method Details

    • createShipBoard

      public static ShipBoard createShipBoard(GameMode mode, HousingColor color, FlyBoard flyBoard)
      Static factory method used to create an instance of ShipBoard based on the specified GameMode.
      Parameters:
      mode - The GameMode of the game (e.g., EASY, NORMAL).
      color - The HousingColor of the player's starting cabin.
      flyBoard - The FlyBoard instance, used to retrieve component definitions and interact with game events.
      Returns:
      A concrete ShipBoard instance (e.g., ShipBoardEasy, ShipBoardNormal).

    • drawShipboard

      public void drawShipboard()
      Placeholder method for drawing the shipboard, intended for GUI implementations. Concrete subclasses or external rendering classes would implement this.

    • getHousingColor

      public HousingColor getHousingColor()
      Returns the HousingColor associated with this shipboard.
      Returns:
      The HousingColor of the ship.

    • getBannedCoordinates

      protected abstract List<Cordinate> getBannedCoordinates()
      Returns a list of Cordinate objects that are banned for component placement on this shipboard. This method must be implemented by concrete subclasses to define mode-specific banned areas.
      Returns:
      A List of banned Cordinates.

    • addBookedComponent

      public void addBookedComponent(Integer bookedComponent) throws IncorrectShipBoardException
      Attempts to add a component to one of the two "booked" slots. A booked component is a component a player has selected but not yet placed on the ship grid.
      Parameters:
      bookedComponent - The ID of the component to be booked.
      Throws:
      IncorrectShipBoardException - If both booked slots are already occupied.

    • swapBookComponent

      public void swapBookComponent(int bookedComponent, int position)
      Swaps an existing booked component with a new one at a specified position. This is useful for players deciding to replace a previously booked component.
      Parameters:
      bookedComponent - The ID of the new component to place in the booked slot.
      position - The index of the booked slot to swap (0 or 1).

    • getBookedComponents

      public List<Optional<Integer>> getBookedComponents()
      Returns a list of Optional integers, representing the IDs of the booked components. An Optional.empty() indicates an empty booked slot.
      Returns:
      A List of Optional<Integer> for the booked components.

    • removedBookedComponent

      public void removedBookedComponent(int position)
      Removes a component from a specified booked slot, making that slot empty.
      Parameters:
      position - The index of the booked slot to clear (0 or 1).

    • getActivatedFirePower

      public double getActivatedFirePower()
      Returns the currently activated firepower of the ship. This value can be temporarily increased by activating DoubleDrill components.
      Returns:
      The activated firepower.

    • setActivatedFirePower

      public void setActivatedFirePower(double activatedFirePower)
      Sets the activated firepower of the ship. This is typically used to update the firepower value after a DoubleDrill has been activated or deactivated.
      Parameters:
      activatedFirePower - The new value for activated firepower.

    • getOffsetCol

      public int getOffsetCol()
      Returns the column offset used for internal grid calculations or visual rendering.
      Returns:
      The column offset.

    • getOffsetRow

      public int getOffsetRow()
      Returns the row offset used for internal grid calculations or visual rendering.
      Returns:
      The row offset.

    • getBaseEnginePower

      public int getBaseEnginePower()
      Calculates and returns the base engine power of the ship. This is the sum of engine power from all installed engine components, without considering the activation of DoubleEngines. Brown aliens (Cosmic Tourists) add +2 engine power if any engine is present.
      Returns:
      The total base engine power.

    • getBaseFirePower

      public double getBaseFirePower()
      Calculates and returns the base firepower of the ship. This is the sum of firepower from all installed drill components, without considering the activation of DoubleDrills. Purple aliens (Cosmic Pirates) add +2 firepower if any drill is present.
      Returns:
      The total base firepower.

    • getStoredQuantity

      public int getStoredQuantity(GoodType type)
      Returns the number of goods of a specific type currently stored in the ship's cargo holds.
      Parameters:
      type - The GoodType to search for.
      Returns:
      The total quantity of the specified good type.

    • getAdjacent

      public Map<Direction,Component> getAdjacent(Cordinate cord)
      Returns a map of all components adjacent to the given coordinate.
      Parameters:
      cord - the coordinate for which adjacent components should be found
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the Direction of the adjacent component relative to the given coordinate, and the value is the corresponding Component

    • addComponentToPosition

      public void addComponentToPosition(int componentId, Cordinate cordinate, int angle) throws IncorrectShipBoardException
      Add the [Component] with given id, to the given rotation, after rotates it
      Parameters:
      componentId - the id of the [Component] to insert
      cordinate - the position where to insert id
      angle - the angle to rotate
      Throws:
      IncorrectShipBoardException - if the cordinate is invalid

    • getOptComponentByCord

      public Optional<Component> getOptComponentByCord(Cordinate cordinate)
      return the Component if present, Optional.of otherwise
      Parameters:
      cordinate - the Cordinate for the search
      Returns:

    • removeComponent

      public void removeComponent(Cordinate cordinate) throws IncorrectShipBoardException
      Parameters:
      cordinate - the Cordinate of the tile to empty
      Throws:
      IncorrectShipBoardException - if the tile is already empty

    • getDiscaredComponents

      public int getDiscaredComponents()
      Returns the total number of components that have been discarded from the shipboard.
      Returns:
      The count of discarded components.

    • removeEnergy

      public List<Integer> removeEnergy(int quantiy) throws IncorrectShipBoardException
      Remove the given quantity of energy from EnergyDepot if possible, throws IncorrectShipBoardException otherwise
      Parameters:
      quantiy - the quanity to remove
      Returns:
      the list of id Component from which the energy have been taken
      Throws:
      IncorrectShipBoardException - if not enough energy to remove

    • getComponentsMatrix

      public Optional<Component>[][] getComponentsMatrix()
      Returns the 2D array representing the ship's grid, containing Optional of Components. This method exposes the internal structure, which should be used carefully to avoid direct modification.
      Returns:
      The 2D array of Optional<Component>.

    • getComponentIdsMatrix

      public Optional<Integer>[][] getComponentIdsMatrix()
      Returns a new 2D matrix representing the ship's grid, where each cell contains the ID of the component if present, or Optional.empty() if the position is empty. This is useful for communicating component layout to clients without sending full component objects.
      Returns:
      A new 2D array of Optional<Integer> representing component IDs.

    • getComponentRotationsMatrix

      public Optional<Integer>[][] getComponentRotationsMatrix()
      Returns a new 2D matrix representing the rotation of components on the shipboard. Each cell contains the rotation angle (in degrees) if a component is present, or Optional.empty() if the position is empty. This is primarily used for GUI rendering to correctly display component orientation.
      Returns:
      A new 2D array of Optional<Integer> representing component rotations.

    • getQuantBatteries

      public int getQuantBatteries()
      Returns the total number of energy units (batteries) currently stored across all EnergyDepot components on the ship.
      Returns:
      The total quantity of batteries.

    • getDoubleEngine

      public List<Integer> getDoubleEngine()

    • getIncorrectEngines

      public List<Cordinate> getIncorrectEngines()
      Returns a list of coordinates of incorrect engines.

      An engine is considered incorrect if:

      • It is not facing Direction.BACK
      • There is at least one component placed below it

      Returns:
      a list of Cordinate objects representing the positions of incorrect engines.

    • getIncorrectDrills

      public List<Cordinate> getIncorrectDrills()
      Returns a list of coordinates of incorrect drills.

      A drill is considered incorrect if there is at least one other component in the direction it is facing. If there are no components in that direction up to the edge of the grid, the drill is considered correct.

      Returns:
      a list of Cordinate objects representing the positions of incorrect drills.

    • getIncorrectConnectedComponents

      public List<Cordinate> getIncorrectConnectedComponents()
      Returns the set of coordinates of components that are incorrectly connected on the shipboard.
      Returns:
      a Set of Cordinate objects representing the positions of components that are not correctly connected based on their connectors.

    • getMultiplePieces

      public List<Set<Component>> getMultiplePieces()
      Returns a list of groups of Components that are not connected to each other through compatible connectors. Each group represents a disconnected "piece" of the ship.

      If the ship is fully connected, this method returns a list with a single set. Otherwise, it returns multiple sets representing disconnected parts.

      Returns:
      a list of sets of components that are not mutually connected.

    • getIncorrectComponents

      public List<Cordinate> getIncorrectComponents()
      Returns a list of coordinates of all ship components that are considered invalid.

      This includes:

      • Components that are not properly connected to the ship
      • Engines placed in invalid positions
      • Drills placed in invalid positions
      Before performing the checks, it clears two reserved component slots (positions [0][5] and [0][6]).
      Returns:
      a list of distinct coordinates of all invalid components

    • isShipValid

      public boolean isShipValid()
      Checks whether the current ship configuration is valid.

      A ship is considered valid if:

      • It has no invalid components (disconnected, misoriented, or misplaced parts)
      • All components form a single connected structure (no multiple isolated pieces)
      Returns:
      true if the ship is valid, false otherwise

    • addGuestToShip

      public void addGuestToShip()
      Updates all housing components on the ship by setting their allowed guests.

      For each housing component, it examines adjacent components and adds their alien colors as allowed guests, based on proximity.

    • getExposedConnectors

      public int getExposedConnectors()
      Calculates and returns the total number of exposed connectors on the perimeter of the ship. An exposed connector is a connector (not FLAT) of a component that is not connected to another component.
      Returns:
      The total count of exposed connectors.

    • getQuantityGuests

      public int getQuantityGuests()
      Returns the total number of guests (aliens) currently hosted across all Housing components on the ship.
      Returns:
      The total quantity of guests.

    • stoleGood

      public Map<Integer,List<GoodType>> stoleGood(int quantity)
      Simulates stealing a given quantity of goods and/or batteries from the ship. It prioritizes stealing goods from highest value to lowest value, then moves to batteries if the quantity still needs to be met.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The total quantity of goods/batteries to steal.
      Returns:
      A Map where keys are component IDs and values are lists of GoodType that were stolen from that component.

    • setActivatedEnginePower

      public void setActivatedEnginePower(int activatedEnginePower)
      Sets the currently activated engine power of the ship. This value is temporary and used during specific adventure card effects where DoubleEngines might be activated.
      Parameters:
      activatedEnginePower - The new value for activated engine power.

    • getActivatedEnginePower

      public int getActivatedEnginePower()
      Returns the currently activated engine power of the ship.
      Returns:
      The activated engine power.

    • compareCrew

      public int compareCrew(ShipBoard other)
      Compares this ship's crew size with another ship's crew size.
      Parameters:
      other - the other ShipBoard to compare with
      Returns:
      1 if this ship has more guests, -1 if fewer, 0 if equal

    • compareActivatedFirePower

      public int compareActivatedFirePower(ShipBoard other)
      Compares this ship's firepower with another ship's firepower.
      Parameters:
      other - the other ShipBoard to compare with
      Returns:
      1 if this ship has more firepower, -1 if fewer, 0 if equal

    • compareActivatedEnginePower

      public int compareActivatedEnginePower(ShipBoard other)
      Compares this ship's engine power with another ship's engine power.
      Parameters:
      other - the other ShipBoard to compare with
      Returns:
      1 if this ship has more engine power, -1 if fewer, 0 if equal

    • keepPart

      public void keepPart(int row, int col)

    • getComponents

      public List<Optional<Component>> getComponents()
      Returns a flat list of all Optional Component objects currently on the ShipBoard, including empty slots represented by Optional.empty().
      Returns:
      A List of Optional<Component>.

    • getAvailableDepots

      public List<Cordinate> getAvailableDepots(GoodType type)
      Parameters:
      type - : the GoodType to search for availability
      Returns:
      a List of Cordinate for the valid spots of the Depot

    • getDoubleDrills

      public List<Cordinate> getDoubleDrills()
      Returns a list of Cordinate objects for all DoubleDrill components currently placed on the shipboard.
      Returns:
      A List of Cordinates where Double Drills are located.

    • coveredByShield

      public boolean coveredByShield(Direction direction)
      Checks whether there exists a Shield component on the ship that can cover the specified Direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The Direction (e.g., FRONT, LEFT) to check for shield coverage.
      Returns:
      true if a shield exists that covers the given direction, false otherwise.

    • getDrills

      public List<Cordinate> getDrills(Direction direction)
      Returns a List of Cordinate objects for all Drill components (including DoubleDrills) on the ship that are facing the given Direction. This is useful for identifying drills that can be used to mitigate threats from a specific direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The Direction a drill must be facing to be included in the result.
      Returns:
      A List of Cordinates where drills facing the specified direction are located.

    • possibleDrills

      public List<Cordinate> possibleDrills(Direction direction, int number)
      Returns a list of drill coordinates in the specified direction that are aligned or near the given row or column number.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to consider (FRONT, BACK, LEFT, RIGHT)
      number - the reference row or column number
      Returns:
      list of coordinates of drills matching the criteria

    • getNumberHumans

      public int getNumberHumans()
      Counts the total number of human guests present across all ship components.
      Returns:
      the total count of human guests

    • getAvailableHousing

      public List<Cordinate> getAvailableHousing(GuestType type)
      Returns a list of coordinates of housing components that can accommodate a guest of the specified type.
      Parameters:
      type - the guest type to check for availability
      Returns:
      list of coordinates of available housing components
